errorCannotOpenNoteWithoutFilePath: Error: Cannot open {0} note without file path.

name: Name
customFoldersPlaceholderWarning: Custom folders use {story*} placeholders. Select or create an active story, then click "Rescan custom folders".

groupsHelpCharacter: Assign this character to one or more groups.
title: Title
caption: Caption
forwardDateBias: Forward-date bias for natural language parsing

locationDescriptionPh: A brief description of the location...
locationHistoryPh: The location's history and past events...

exampleRelationshipLabel: e.g., Best friend, Sibling, Business partner
noRelationshipsFound: No relationships found. Add connections between entities to visualize them in the network graph.
storyBoardUpdatedPreserved: Story board updated! Manual edits preserved.

noScenesForStoryBoard: No scenes found. Create some scenes first!

errorOpeningStoryBoard: Error opening story board. See console for details.
storyBoardEmpty: No scenes found. The story board will be empty.
errorReadingStoryBoard: Error reading existing story board. It may be corrupted.
errorUpdatingStoryBoard: Error updating story board. See console for details.
storyBoardLayoutDesc: Choose how to organize scenes on the canvas
storyBoardColorByDesc: Choose what determines scene card colors
storyBoardShowEdgesDesc: Display arrows connecting scenes in sequence
label: Label
milestoneDesc: Mark this event as a key story moment
dependenciesDesc: Events that must occur before this one
editModeEnabled: Edit mode enabled - drag events to reschedule
noCharactersFound: No characters found. Click "Create new" to add your first character.
groupNameExists: A group with this name already exists. Please choose a different name.
confirmDeleteGroup: Are you sure you want to delete group "{0}"?
confirmDeleteCharacter: Are you sure you want to delete "{0}"?
confirmDeleteEvent: Are you sure you want to delete the event "{0}"? This will move the note to system trash.
confirmDeleteLocation: Are you sure you want to delete "{0}"?
confirmDeleteItem: Are you sure you want to delete "{0}"?
confirmDeleteStory: Delete story "{0}"? This cannot be undone.
confirmRemoveImageFromGallery: Are you sure you want to remove "{0}" from the gallery? This does not delete the file itself.
confirmDeleteCharacterTrash: Are you sure you want to delete "{0}"? This will move the file to system trash.
confirmDeleteItemTrash: Are you sure you want to delete "{0}"? This will move the file to system trash.
customFieldError: Custom field name must be unique, non-empty, and not reserved.
circularLocationError: Cannot set parent location: This would create a circular reference.
couldNotFindNote: Could not find the note file.
autoDetectedStories: Storyteller: Auto-detected and imported {0} new story folder(s).
storiesRefreshed: Storyteller: Found and imported {0} new story folder(s).
noNewStoriesFound: Storyteller: No new story folders found.
errorScanningFolders: Storyteller Suite: Error scanning custom folders: {0}
couldNotAutoDetect: Storyteller: Could not auto-detect a story root. Please set folders manually.
errorUploadingFile: Error uploading file. Check console for details.
customTodayPh: YYYY-MM-DD or full ISO (supports BCE dates)
selectGalleryImagePh: Select an image from the gallery...
scanVaultDesc: Scan your vault for existing Storyteller stories and import them. Useful after moving folders or changing structure.
galleryFolderDesc: Folder where uploaded gallery images will be stored
customFieldsDesc: Choose how custom fields are stored in frontmatter
forwardDateBiasDesc: Prefer future interpretation for relative dates (e.g., "Friday")
customTodayDesc: Optional date used for the Today button and relative parsing. Supports BCE dates (e.g., 2024-01-15 for CE, or -00499-01-01 for 500 BCE). Leave empty to use system today.
timelineHeightDesc: Adjust the height of the timeline modal
useCustomFoldersDesc: When enabled, use the folder paths below. You can include {storyName}, {storySlug}, or {storyId} to make per-story folders (e.g., Creative/Writing/{storyName}/Characters).
previewFoldersDesc: See each entity's resolved folder path based on current settings and active story
storyRootDesc: Base path template for all entities. Supports {storyName}, {storySlug}, {storyId}. Example: Creative/Writing/{storyName}
charactersFolderDesc: Path for character markdown files (placeholders allowed: {storyName}, {storySlug}, {storyId})
locationsFolderDesc: Path for location markdown files (placeholders allowed: {storyName}, {storySlug}, {storyId})
eventsFolderDesc: Path for event markdown files (placeholders allowed: {storyName}, {storySlug}, {storyId})
itemsFolderDesc: Path for item markdown files (placeholders allowed: {storyName}, {storySlug}, {storyId})
referencesFolderDesc: Path for reference markdown files (placeholders allowed: {storyName}, {storySlug}, {storyId})
scenesFolderDesc: Path for scene markdown files (placeholders allowed: {storyName}, {storySlug}, {storyId})
chaptersFolderDesc: Path for chapter markdown files (placeholders allowed: {storyName}, {storySlug}, {storyId})
oneStoryModeDesc: Flatten the folder structure to a single story. When enabled (and custom folders disabled), content goes under a single base folder without Stories/StoryName.
showTutorialDesc: Display the tutorial and getting started section in settings
supportDevDesc: If you find this plugin helpful, consider supporting its development
pluginInfoDesc: Storyteller Suite - A comprehensive suite for managing characters, locations, events, and galleries for your stories.
parentLocationDesc: Select a parent location that contains this location.
assignToGroupsDesc: Assign this location to one or more groups.
manageGroupsDesc: Manage your groups. Shared across all entity types.
searchGroupsDesc: Search by group name or description.
assignEventToGroupsDesc: Assign this event to one or more groups.
assignItemToGroupsDesc: Assign this item to one or more groups.
assignCharacterToGroupsDesc: Assign this character to one or more groups.
emptyGraphMessage: Create characters, locations, events, or items to see them in the network graph.
emptyGraphTip: Add relationships between entities to see connections visualized here.
noNodesVisible: No nodes visible with current filters
economyNameDesc: Name of the economic system (e.g., "Kingdom of Eldoria Economy")
industriesDesc: Major industries, production, and economic activities
taxationDesc: Tax system, trade regulations, and economic policies
economyDescriptionDesc: Overview and characteristics of the economic system
confirmDeleteEconomy: Are you sure you want to delete economy "{0}"? This will move the note to system trash.
cultureNameDesc: Name of the culture or society
languagesDesc: Comma-separated list of languages spoken (e.g., Common, Elvish, Dwarvish)
valuesBeliefsDesc: Core cultural values, worldview, and philosophical beliefs
religionDesc: Religious beliefs, practices, and deities worshipped
socialStructureDesc: Class hierarchy, social organization, and caste systems
namingConventionsDesc: How members of this culture name people, places, and things
customsTraditionsDesc: Cultural practices, ceremonies, holidays, and traditions
cultureDescriptionDesc: Overview and key characteristics of the culture
cultureHistoryDesc: Origins, major historical events, and cultural evolution
confirmDeleteCulture: Delete culture "{0}"? This will move the note to system trash.
magicSystemNameDesc: Name of the magic system (e.g., "Arcane Arts", "Divine Magic")
systemTypeDesc: Source or category of magical power
rarityDesc: How common is magic in the world?
powerLevelDesc: Overall potency of this magic system
rulesMechanicsDesc: How magic is used, cast, or channeled
sourceDesc: Where does magical power come from?
costsConsequencesDesc: What does using magic cost the caster?
limitationsDesc: What are the boundaries and restrictions of this magic?
trainingLearningDesc: How is magic learned and mastered?
confirmDeleteMagicSystem: Delete magic system "{0}"? This will move the note to system trash.
magicSystemStatusDesc: Current state of the magic system
magicSystemDescriptionDesc: Overview and explanation of the magic system
magicSystemHistoryDesc: Origins, discovery, and evolution of the magic system
startFromTemplateDesc: Optionally start with a pre-configured template
noTemplatesAvailable: This template does not contain any items
cannotOpenWithoutPath: Cannot open note without file path.
browseManageTemplates: Browse and manage reusable templates for characters, locations, and other entities.
searchTemplatesPlaceholder: Search templates by name, description, or tags...
noTemplatesFound: No templates found. Try adjusting your filters or create a new template.
templateSelected: Template "{0}" selected. Apply this template from the entity creation modal.
confirmDeleteTemplate: Are you sure you want to delete the template "{0}"? This action cannot be undone.
dashboardTabVisibilityDesc: Choose which tabs to show in the dashboard sidebar. Hidden tabs will not appear in the tab bar.
refreshDashboardToSeeChanges: . Refresh the dashboard to see changes.
showProgressBarsInGantt: Show progress bars in Gantt view
showProgressBarsInGanttDesc: Display progress bar overlays on Gantt bars to visualize event completion.
defaultGanttDurationDesc: Default duration in days for events without an end date when shown in Gantt view.
dependencyArrowStyleDesc: Visual style for dependency arrows between events in Gantt view.
enableFrontmatterMarkersDesc: Auto-generate markers from notes with location or mapmarkers in frontmatter
enableDataViewMarkersDesc: Auto-generate markers from DataView queries (requires DataView plugin)
tutorialWelcomeDesc: This plugin helps you organize and manage all aspects of your stories. Here's how to get started:
tutorialTip: Tip: Click any section below to expand detailed instructions and examples.
tutorialDashboardRibbon: Click the book-open icon in the left ribbon (sidebar)
tutorialDashboardCommand: Use Command Palette: <kbd>Ctrl/Cmd + P</kbd> → "Storyteller: Open dashboard"
tutorialDashboardHub: The dashboard is your central hub for managing all story elements
tutorialStoryButton: Use the "Create New Story" button below (hidden when One Story Mode is enabled)
tutorialStoryCommand: Or from Command Palette: "Storyteller: Create New Story"
tutorialStoryName: Give your story a name and description
tutorialStoryDefault: By default, the plugin creates folders at StorytellerSuite/Stories/YourStoryName/
tutorialStorySwitch: Switch between stories using the "Set Active" button
tutorialStoryEdit: Edit story details with the pencil icon
tutorialStoryDelete: Delete stories with the trash icon (this only removes from plugin, not your files)
tutorialStoryActivation: Immediate activation tip: Creating a story from Settings updates the settings list immediately, but the dashboard's story dropdown may not refresh until you reopen the dashboard. For instant activation and UI refresh, use the dashboard/command palette action "Storyteller: Create New Story", or close/reopen the dashboard via "Storyteller: Open dashboard".
tutorialStoryOneMode: One Story Mode: When enabled in settings, the interface is simplified to a single-story layout and the New story button is hidden. Content is organized under a single base folder.
tutorialCharacterDetails: Fill in character details, backstory, relationships
tutorialCharacterImages: Add profile images from your vault
tutorialCharacterView: View All: Dashboard → "View Characters" or Command Palette → "Storyteller: View characters"
tutorialCharacterEdit: Edit: Click character name in dashboard or character list
tutorialCharacterDelete: Delete: Use the trash icon (moves to Obsidian trash)
tutorialCharacterStorage: Characters are stored as markdown files in Characters/ folder
tutorialLocationDetails: Add descriptions, history, region, location type
tutorialLocationLink: Link to related characters and events
tutorialLocationView: View All: Dashboard → "View Locations" or Command Palette → "Storyteller: View locations"
tutorialLocationStorage: Locations are stored in Locations/ folder as markdown files
tutorialLocationEdit: Edit by clicking location name, delete with trash icon
tutorialEventLink: Link to involved characters and locations
tutorialEventNew: New: Mark events as milestones, set progress (0-100%), add dependencies
tutorialGanttToggle: Toggle View: Switch between classic Timeline and Gantt view using the toggle button
tutorialGanttMilestones: Milestones: Mark important events as milestones (golden styling with star icon)
tutorialGanttProgress: Progress Tracking: Set completion percentage (0-100%) on events with visual progress bars
tutorialGanttDependencies: Dependencies: Link events to show cause-and-effect relationships with arrows
tutorialGanttLock: Click the lock/pencil icon in the toolbar to enable edit mode
tutorialGanttDragEvents: Drag events to new dates - changes auto-save
tutorialGanttDisable: Click the icon again to disable editing and lock the timeline
tutorialGanttFilterPanel: Filter Panel: Click "Filters" to open the collapsible filter panel
tutorialGanttFilterBy: Filter by: Character, location, group, or milestones-only
tutorialGanttFilterChips: Filter Chips: Click chips to remove individual filters, or "Clear All"
tutorialGanttSwimlanes: Swimlanes: Group events by location, group, or character
tutorialPlotCreate: Create: Dashboard → "Create Plot Item" or Command Palette → "Storyteller: Create new plot item"
tutorialPlotCritical: Mark Critical: Use the "Plot Critical" checkbox for key story items
tutorialPlotOwnership: Track Ownership: Link current owner, past owners, and location
tutorialPlotView: View All: Dashboard → "View Plot Items" or Command Palette → "Storyteller: View plot items"
tutorialGalleryAccess: Access: Dashboard → "Gallery" button or Command Palette → "Storyteller: Open gallery"
tutorialGalleryUpload: Upload: Drag & drop images directly into the gallery
tutorialGalleryOrganize: Organize: Add tags, categories, descriptions to images
tutorialGalleryLink: Link: Easily reference gallery images in character/location profiles
tutorialGroupsAdd: Add Members: Characters, locations, events, and items can be grouped
tutorialGroupsManage: Manage: Rename with "Storyteller: Rename group", delete with "Storyteller: Delete group"
tutorialGroupsUseCases: Use Cases: Royal family, specific kingdoms, plot arcs, etc.
tutorialWorldFive: Five Entity Types for Comprehensive Worldbuilding:
tutorialWorldCultures: Cultures: Tech level, government type, languages, values, customs, social structure
tutorialWorldFactions: Factions: Organizations with type, power level, colors, motto, goals, resources
tutorialWorldEconomies: Economies: System type (barter, market, feudal), industries, trade policy
tutorialWorldMagic: Magic Systems: Type (arcane, divine, natural), rarity, power level, rules, costs
tutorialWorldCalendars: Calendars: Calendar type (solar, lunar), days configuration, weekdays
tutorialWorldModals: Each entity has dedicated modals with relevant fields
tutorialWorldStorage: Entities stored in their respective folders (e.g., Cultures/, Factions/)
tutorialTimelineCreateFork: Create Fork: Command Palette → "Storyteller: Create timeline fork"
tutorialTimelineDivergence: Divergence Point: Select the event where the timeline splits
tutorialTimelineForkStatus: Fork Status: Track as exploring, canon, abandoned, or merged
tutorialTimelineViewForks: View Forks: Use the fork selector dropdown in the timeline view
tutorialTimelineAddLink: Add Link: Command Palette → "Storyteller: Add causality link"
tutorialTimelineLinkTypes: Link Types: Direct, indirect, conditional, or catalyst
tutorialTimelineStrength: Strength Levels: Weak, moderate, strong, or absolute
tutorialTimelineLinksHelp: Links help track how events influence each other
tutorialTimelineRunDetection: Run Detection: Command Palette → "Storyteller: Detect timeline conflicts"
tutorialTimelineDetects: Detects: Location conflicts (character in multiple places), death conflicts (dead characters appearing later), causality violations (effects before causes)
tutorialTimelineBadge: Conflict Badge: Shows count in timeline toolbar - click to review
tutorialTimelineActionable: Actionable: Each conflict includes suggestions for resolution
tutorialTemplatesSave: Save as Template: When editing any entity, save it as a reusable template
tutorialTemplatesLibrary: Template Library: Command Palette → "Storyteller: Open entity template library"
tutorialTemplatesDashboard: Dashboard Tab: Access templates from the Templates tab in the dashboard
tutorialTemplatesArchetypes: Character archetypes: Medieval King, Tavern Keeper, Wise Mentor, Cyberpunk Hacker, Detective
tutorialTemplatesMore: More templates available for quick character creation
tutorialTemplatesBrowse: Browse: Search and filter templates by genre, category, entity type
tutorialTemplatesSort: Sort: By name, usage count, or recently used
tutorialTemplatesUsage: Usage Tracking: See which templates you use most often
tutorialTemplatesCustomize: Customize: Duplicate and modify templates for your needs
tutorialDiscoveryManual: Manual Refresh: Command Palette → "Storyteller: Refresh story discovery"
tutorialDiscoveryImport: Import existing story folders without losing data
tutorialDiscoveryUseful: Useful when moving stories between vaults
tutorialCustomSimple: Simple, reliable setup for custom folders:
tutorialCustomStep1: Create your story folder and subfolders manually in your vault (e.g., Creative/Writing/My_Story/Characters, Locations, Events, etc.).
tutorialCustomStep2: In Settings → Storyteller Suite → enable Use custom entity folders. Optionally set a Story root folder template for convenience.
tutorialCustomStep3: Open the dashboard and use "Create new story". After creation, refresh/activate the dashboard. The plugin will recognize your manual story folder as the active story.
tutorialCustomStep4: Use Preview resolved folders in settings to confirm the exact paths the plugin will use.
tutorialCustomSwitching: Switching stories in custom-folder mode: Use the story dropdown at the top of the dashboard to change the active story. Then go to Settings → Storyteller Suite and manually assign per‑entity folders for that story . Sorry I know this is a bit janky.
tutorialShortcutsNewStory: Storyteller: Create New Story - Start a new story project
tutorialShortcutsRefresh: Storyteller: Refresh story discovery - Import existing folders
tutorialShortcutsTimelineFork: Storyteller: Create timeline fork - Create alternate timeline
tutorialShortcutsTimelineViewForks: Storyteller: View timeline forks - List all forks
tutorialShortcutsTimelineLink: Storyteller: Add causality link - Link cause and effect events
tutorialShortcutsTimelineViewLinks: Storyteller: View causality links - List all causal relationships
tutorialShortcutsTimelineViewConflicts: Storyteller: View timeline conflicts - Review existing conflicts
tutorialShortcutsTemplateLibrary: Storyteller: Open entity template library - Browse and manage templates
tutorialShortcutsTip: Tip: You can assign custom hotkeys to any of these commands in Obsidian's Hotkeys settings!
tutorialFileMarkdown: All data stored as markdown files with frontmatter
tutorialFileDataview: Fully compatible with Dataview plugin for custom queries
tutorialFileWikiLinks: Use [[wiki links]] to connect characters, locations, events
tutorialFileReadable: Files are readable and editable even without the plugin
tutorialFileBackup: Backup safe: Your data is never locked in a proprietary format
tutorialFileTip: Tip: Configure these modes in Settings → Storyteller Suite under Use custom entity folders and One Story Mode. The New story button is hidden automatically in One Story Mode.
